title: Lee Bontecou, Acclaimed Creator of Unusual Sculptures, Dies at 91
description: Her use of what one critic called “a three-dimensional form that was neither painting nor sculpture” earned the kind of praise typically reserved in the 1960s for male art stars.
dc:creator: Jennifer Szalai
category: Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts
media:credit: Fred W. McDarrah/MUUS Collection, via Getty Images
media:description: The artist Lee Bontecou with one of her sculptures at the Leo Castelli Gallery in Manhattan in 1966. She was one of the first women whose work was shown there.
